title: Basic Menu Bar UI
description:
Implement basic menu bar UI showing app status and quit action.

## Requirements
- Menu bar icon (system image or custom)
- Click opens popup menu
- Show current layout name (Fullscreen for Phase 1)
- Show count of floating windows
- Quit action at bottom

## Menu Structure (Phase 1)
- [Layout: Fullscreen]
- [Floating: X windows]
- ---
- Quit

## Technical Details
- Use MenuBarExtra with menu style
- Update menu content when state changes
- Quit should properly cleanup and terminate

## PRD Reference
From "Menu Bar App Constraints":
> - Tiller operates exclusively as a macOS menu bar application
> - No Dock icon is shown

From "Popup UI Structure":
> - Clicking the menu bar icon opens the Tiller popup UI
> - A Quit action is always presented as the final entry

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Menu bar icon visible
- [ ] Click opens popup menu
- [ ] Current layout displayed
- [ ] Floating window count displayed
- [ ] Quit action terminates app cleanly
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testMenuBarIconPresent - Menu bar icon is visible
- [ ] testPopupMenuOpens - Clicking icon opens popup menu
- [ ] testLayoutDisplayed - Current layout name shown in menu
- [ ] testFloatingCountDisplayed - Floating window count shown in menu
- [ ] testQuitActionPresent - Quit action present at bottom of menu
- [ ] testQuitActionTerminatesCleanly - Quit action properly terminates app

title: macOS Native Notification System
description:
Implement macOS native notification center integration for user feedback.

## Requirements
- Show notification when Accessibility permissions denied
- Show notification when config file invalid/malformed
- Request notification permissions if needed

## Notification Types (Phase 1)
1. Permission denied: "Tiller needs Accessibility permissions. Open System Preferences to enable."
2. Config error: "Tiller config file is invalid. Using default settings."

## Technical Details
- Use UNUserNotificationCenter for notifications
- Request notification authorization on first use
- Keep notifications brief and actionable

## PRD Reference
From "Visual Communication":
> - All errors, configuration saves, and command palette commands provide prompt, visible feedback

From "Error Handling - Config File Issues":
> - Malformed or invalid configs are non-fatal. UI displays error banners

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Notification shown when Accessibility permissions denied
- [ ] Notification shown when config file invalid
- [ ] Notifications appear in macOS Notification Center
- [ ] Clicking notification is handled gracefully
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testPermissionDeniedNotification - Notification shown when accessibility denied
- [ ] testConfigErrorNotification - Notification shown when config file invalid
- [ ] testNotificationAuthorizationRequest - Notification permission requested on first use
- [ ] testNotificationContent_PermissionDenied - Correct message for permission denied
- [ ] testNotificationContent_ConfigError - Correct message for config error

title: Fullscreen Layout with Horizontal Accordion
description:
Implement the fullscreen (monocle) layout with horizontal accordion window display.

## Requirements
- Single container spanning full monitor (minus margin)
- Focused window fills container
- For 3+ windows: neighbors peek 8px from left and right edges
- For 2 windows: one window focused, other peeks from left only
- Apply margin from config (8px default)
- Apply accordion offset from config (8px default)

## Layout Calculation
Given monitor usable frame and config:
- Container frame = monitor.visibleFrame.insetBy(dx: margin, dy: margin)
- Focused window frame = container frame
- Left neighbor: x = container.minX - windowWidth + accordionOffset
- Right neighbor: x = container.maxX - accordionOffset

## Visual Behavior
- Focused window fully visible
- Immediate neighbors partially visible (peek amount = accordionOffset)
- Windows beyond immediate neighbors are hidden

## Technical Details
- Use AXUIElementSetAttributeValue for AXPosition and AXSize
- Apply frames using CGRect calculations
- Handle edge cases (1 window = just fullscreen, no accordion)

## PRD Reference
From "Strict Layout and Containment":
> - Organizing hierarchy per monitor: Layout > Container(s) > Window(s)
> - Exactly seven distinct layouts: 1. Full screen (monocle)

From "Accordion Visual Logic":
> - Each container displays up to three windows:
>   - Focused window is fully visible with subtle inset
>   - Neighboring windows are partially visible on each side
>   - Only focused and immediate neighbor windows appear; others are hidden behind
> - Configurable Accordion Offset: 4px-24px (default 8px)

From "Config File Management":
> - Margin (container outer gap): 0-20px (default 8px)
> - Accordion offset: 4-24px (default 8px)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Fullscreen layout tiles all windows in single container
- [ ] Focused window fills container area
- [ ] 8px margin applied around container (from config)
- [ ] For 3+ windows: neighbors peek 8px from left/right
- [ ] For 2 windows: secondary peeks from left only
- [ ] For 1 window: simple fullscreen, no accordion
- [ ] Layout uses config values (margin, accordionOffset)
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testSingleWindowLayout - Single window fills container (no accordion)
- [ ] testTwoWindowLayout - Focused window full, secondary peeks from left only
- [ ] testThreeWindowLayout - Focused full, neighbors peek from left and right
- [ ] testFourPlusWindowLayout - Only focused + 2 neighbors visible, others hidden
- [ ] testMarginApplication - Container inset by config margin (default 8px)
- [ ] testAccordionOffsetApplication - Neighbor peek amount matches config (default 8px)
- [ ] testLayoutUsesConfigValues - Layout respects non-default config values
- [ ] testContainerFrameCalculation - Container frame = monitor.visibleFrame.insetBy(margin)
- [ ] testFocusedWindowFrame - Focused window frame equals container frame
- [ ] testLeftNeighborPosition - Left neighbor x = container.minX - windowWidth + accordionOffset
- [ ] testRightNeighborPosition - Right neighbor x = container.maxX - accordionOffset

title: Monitor Detection Service
description:
Implement monitor detection and tracking for multi-display support.

## Requirements
- Detect all connected monitors on startup
- Get usable screen area (excluding menu bar, dock)
- Track active/focused monitor
- Detect monitor connect/disconnect events

## Technical Details
- Use NSScreen.screens for monitor enumeration
- Use screen.visibleFrame for usable area
- Use NSWorkspace.didActivateApplicationNotification and window focus to track active monitor
- Use NSApplication.didChangeScreenParametersNotification for hotplug

## PRD Reference
From "Per-Monitor State":
> - Independent tiling and state for each monitor
> - Layouts, containers, and window positioning for each monitor persist across disconnects and reconnects

From "Monitor Focus Handling":
> - The UI and view always reflect the current active monitor

From "Performance and Scalability":
> - Supports simultaneous management of up to 6 displays

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All monitors detected on startup
- [ ] Usable frame (minus menu bar) calculated per monitor
- [ ] Active monitor tracked based on focused window
- [ ] Monitor connect/disconnect events handled
- [ ] Monitor list accessible to other modules
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testMonitorEnumeration - All connected monitors detected on startup
- [ ] testUsableFrameCalculation - Usable frame excludes menu bar and dock
- [ ] testActiveMonitorTracking - Active monitor updates based on focused window
- [ ] testMonitorConnectEvent - New monitor detected when connected
- [ ] testMonitorDisconnectEvent - Removed monitor handled when disconnected
- [ ] testMonitorListAccessible - Monitor list accessible to other modules
- [ ] testUpToSixDisplaysSupported - Handles up to 6 displays per PRD
close_reason: Monitor detection service implemented with full test coverage

title: Auto-Tiling Orchestration
description:
Implement automatic tiling orchestration that responds to window events.

## Requirements
- Tile all windows on app launch
- Re-tile when new windows open
- Re-tile when windows close
- Skip floating windows during tiling
- Apply to all monitors

## Event Triggers
- App launch: tile all existing windows
- Window created: add to layout and re-tile
- Window destroyed: remove from layout and re-tile
- Window focus changed: update accordion focus and re-tile

## Technical Details
- Subscribe to WindowDiscoveryService events
- Filter out floating windows before tiling
- Call FullscreenLayout to calculate and apply positions
- Handle rapid events (debounce if needed)

## PRD Reference
From "Day-to-Day Window Management":
> - Windows tile automatically to the active layout per monitor

From "Initial App Launch":
> - All windows on the main monitor are immediately tiled in the fullscreen (monocle) layout

From "Automated Detection":
> - Floating windows are excluded from tiling actions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All non-floating windows tiled on app launch
- [ ] New windows automatically added to layout
- [ ] Closed windows removed, layout re-calculated
- [ ] Floating windows never included in tiling
- [ ] Works across multiple monitors
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testInitialTiling - All non-floating windows tiled on app launch
- [ ] testNewWindowAdded - New window added to layout triggers re-tile
- [ ] testWindowClosed - Closed window removed, layout re-calculated
- [ ] testFloatingWindowExcluded - Floating windows never included in tiling
- [ ] testMultipleMonitorTiling - Tiling works across multiple monitors
- [ ] testRapidEvents_Debounced - Rapid window events are debounced appropriately
- [ ] testWindowFocusChange_UpdatesAccordion - Focus change updates accordion display

title: Floating Window Detection
description:
Implement automatic detection and exclusion of floating windows from tiling.

## Requirements
- Auto-detect dialogs, modals, and palettes using Accessibility APIs
- Detect windows that cannot be resized (non-resizable)
- Mark detected windows as "floating" (excluded from tiling)
- Support manual floating list from config (floatingApps array)

## Detection Criteria
- Window role is "AXDialog" or "AXSheet"
- Window subrole indicates modal or palette
- Window is not resizable (AXSizeAttribute not settable)
- App bundle ID is in config.floatingApps array

## Technical Details
- Use AXUIElementCopyAttributeValue for AXRole, AXSubrole
- Check kAXSizeAttribute for resizability
- Floating windows remain above tiled windows
- Update floating status when windows are created

## PRD Reference
From "Automated Detection":
> - Tiller automatically marks windows as floating if they are:
>   - Dialogs
>   - Modals
>   - Palettes/tool windows (using macOS Accessibility APIs)
> - Floating windows are visually above tiled containers and excluded from tiling actions

From "User Control of Floating Windows":
> - Users may add applications to a global float/ignore list

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dialogs auto-detected as floating
- [ ] Modals auto-detected as floating
- [ ] Non-resizable windows auto-detected as floating
- [ ] Apps in floatingApps config are floating
- [ ] Floating windows excluded from tiling
- [ ] Floating detection runs on window creation
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testDialogDetection - Windows with AXRole "AXDialog" detected as floating
- [ ] testSheetDetection - Windows with AXRole "AXSheet" detected as floating
- [ ] testModalDetection - Modal subrole windows detected as floating
- [ ] testPaletteDetection - Palette subrole windows detected as floating
- [ ] testNonResizableDetection - Non-resizable windows detected as floating
- [ ] testConfigFloatingApps - Apps in floatingApps config array marked floating
- [ ] testFloatingExcludedFromTiling - Floating windows excluded from tiling calculations
- [ ] testFloatingDetectionOnWindowCreation - Detection runs when windows are created
- [ ] testNormalWindowNotFloating - Standard resizable windows not marked floating

title: Accessibility Permissions System
description:
Implement macOS Accessibility permission handling for Tiller window manager.

## Requirements
- On app launch, check if Accessibility permissions are granted
- If not granted, prompt user with macOS native permission dialog
- If denied, show macOS notification explaining how to enable in System Preferences
- Provide utility function to check permission status for other modules

## Technical Details
- Use AXIsProcessTrusted() to check permission status
- Use AXIsProcessTrustedWithOptions() with prompt option to request permissions
- Poll permission status after showing System Preferences (user may grant while app running)

## PRD Reference
From "System Integrity and Permissions":
> - Tiller must never require disabling or weakening macOS System Integrity Protection (SIP)
> - All window management and accessibility features employ only supported macOS APIs for permissions

From "Initial App Launch":
> - Standard macOS accessibility permission requests are made

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] App requests Accessibility permissions on first launch
- [ ] Permission status is checkable by other modules
- [ ] Denied permissions show helpful notification
- [ ] Permission granted allows window enumeration to proceed
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testPermissionStatusCheck - Can query current accessibility permission status
- [ ] testPermissionGranted - Returns true when permissions granted
- [ ] testPermissionDenied - Returns false when permissions denied
- [ ] testPermissionCheckAvailableToModules - Other modules can check permission status

Note: Permission request/prompt flows require UI interaction and are better suited for integration tests.
close_reason: Implemented accessibility permissions system with manager, polling, callback, notifications, and unit tests

title: Configuration File System
description:
Implement auto-creating configuration file system for Tiller.

## Requirements
- On app startup, check for config file at ~/.config/tiller/config.json
- If missing, create directory and file with default values
- Load config into memory for runtime use
- Validate config schema on load
- If invalid, use defaults and show notification

## Default Config Values (Phase 1)
```json
{
  "margin": 8,        // Container outer gap (0-20px)
  "padding": 8,       // Gap between containers (0-20px)
  "accordionOffset": 8,  // Peek amount (4-24px)
  "floatingApps": []  // Bundle IDs of always-floating apps
}
```

## Technical Details
- Use FileManager for file operations
- Use JSONDecoder/JSONEncoder for serialization
- Create ~/.config/tiller directory if needed
- Config should be a singleton accessible app-wide

## PRD Reference
From "Config File Management":
> - Location: ~/.config/tiller
> - Format: User-selectable, JSON or YAML
> - Supported Settings:
>   - Margin (container outer gap): 0-20px (default 8px)
>   - Padding (gap between containers): 0-20px (default 8px)
>   - Accordion offset: 4-24px (default 8px)
>   - Floating application ignore list

From "Configuration Schema and Validation":
> - All config files are schema-validated on load and save
> - If config is invalid/malformed, only affected features are disabled and notification shown

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Config file auto-created at ~/.config/tiller/config.json if missing
- [ ] Default values match PRD specs (margin: 8, padding: 8, accordionOffset: 8)
- [ ] Config loaded into memory on startup
- [ ] Invalid config falls back to defaults with notification
- [ ] Config values accessible throughout app
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testDefaultConfigCreation - Creates config at ~/.config/tiller/config.json when missing
- [ ] testDefaultConfigValues - Default values match PRD (margin: 8, padding: 8, accordionOffset: 8, floatingApps: [])
- [ ] testConfigDirectoryCreation - Creates ~/.config/tiller directory if missing
- [ ] testConfigLoading - Loads existing valid config file into memory
- [ ] testConfigValidation_ValidConfig - Valid config passes schema validation
- [ ] testConfigValidation_InvalidMargin - Margin outside 0-20px range rejected
- [ ] testConfigValidation_InvalidPadding - Padding outside 0-20px range rejected
- [ ] testConfigValidation_InvalidAccordionOffset - Offset outside 4-24px range rejected
- [ ] testInvalidConfigFallback - Invalid config falls back to defaults
- [ ] testConfigSingletonAccess - Config accessible as singleton throughout app
close_reason: Implemented config file system with all 10 tests passing

title: Window Animation System
description:
Implement smooth animated transitions for window movements.

## Requirements
- 200ms duration for all window transitions
- Hardware accelerated animations
- Target 60fps, no dropped frames
- Synchronized animation for multiple windows

## Technical Details
- Use NSAnimationContext for coordinated animations
- Animate both position and size together
- Consider using CAAnimation for hardware acceleration
- May need to batch window updates for synchronization

## PRD Reference
From "Animated Transitions":
> - All window movements and layout changes animate with:
>   - Native macOS-style animation
>   - 200ms duration per transition
>   - Hardware acceleration and 60fps target; no dropped frames

From "Animated Behavior":
> - All window moves, resizes, layout changes are animated with a 200ms default duration
> - Synchronization: All related containers and windows animate together

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Window movements animate smoothly
- [ ] Animation duration is 200ms
- [ ] Multiple windows animate in sync
- [ ] No visual stuttering or dropped frames
- [ ] Works with accordion transitions
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testAnimationDuration - Animation duration is 200ms
- [ ] testSynchronizedAnimations - Multiple windows animate in sync
- [ ] testPositionAnimation - Window position animates smoothly
- [ ] testSizeAnimation - Window size animates smoothly
- [ ] testCombinedPositionAndSizeAnimation - Position and size animate together
- [ ] testAccordionTransitions - Accordion focus changes animate correctly

title: Window Discovery Service
description:
Implement window enumeration and tracking using macOS Accessibility APIs.

## Requirements
- Enumerate all application windows on screen
- Track window properties: title, app name, bundle ID, frame, isResizable
- Detect window open/close events
- Detect window focus changes
- Provide window list to other modules

## Technical Details
- Use CGWindowListCopyWindowInfo for initial enumeration
- Use AXObserver for window events (created, destroyed, moved, resized)
- Use AXUIElementCopyAttributeValue for window properties
- Track windows by windowID or AXUIElement reference

## PRD Reference
From "macOS Integration Details":
> - Uses macOS Accessibility APIs for all window management

From "Window Focus-Driven Selection":
> - Focusing any window on a monitor makes that monitor active in Tiller

From "Window State Persistence":
> - Complete container/window state for each monitor is saved

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can enumerate all visible windows
- [ ] Window properties (title, app, frame, resizable) retrievable
- [ ] Window open events detected
- [ ] Window close events detected
- [ ] Window focus change events detected
- [ ] Window list updates in real-time
notes:
## Planned Unit Tests
- [ ] testWindowEnumeration - All visible windows enumerated
- [ ] testWindowPropertyRetrieval_Title - Window title retrievable
- [ ] testWindowPropertyRetrieval_AppName - App name retrievable
- [ ] testWindowPropertyRetrieval_BundleID - Bundle ID retrievable
- [ ] testWindowPropertyRetrieval_Frame - Window frame retrievable
- [ ] testWindowPropertyRetrieval_IsResizable - Resizable status retrievable
- [ ] testWindowOpenEventDetected - Window creation events detected
- [ ] testWindowCloseEventDetected - Window destruction events detected
- [ ] testWindowFocusEventDetected - Window focus change events detected
- [ ] testWindowListUpdatesRealtime - Window list updates in real-time
